body:
### Problem

Opening a largish markdown file gives the following error:
```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.
lua:406: attempt to yield across C-call boundary
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'yield'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:406: in function '_parse_region
s'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:618: in function '_parse'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:585: in function 'parse'
        ...issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/context.lua:192: in function 'callback'
        ...issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/context.lua:214: in function 'for_each'
        ...issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/context.lua:191: in function 'parse'
        ...t/ts_issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/ui.lua:202: in function 'parse_buffer'

        ...t/ts_issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/ui.lua:139: in function 'run_update'
        ...t/ts_issue/nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/ui.lua:91: in function <...t/ts_issue/
nvim_issue/2//lua/render-markdown/core/ui.lua:90>
```

Sometimes but not always, you also get the following error:
```
Error in decoration provider "conceal_line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
Error executing lua: ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:406: attempt to yi
eld across C-call boundary
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'yield'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:406: in function '_parse_region
s'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:618: in function '_parse'
        ...r/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:585: in function 'parse'
        ...er/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:439: in function <...er/share/n
vim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:431>
```

While this is coming from the `render-markdown` plugin, I think it's only because that plugin is exercising the `parse` function so much. This was mentioned  in MeanderingProgrammer/render-markdown.nvim#387.

### Steps to reproduce

```
nvim --clean -u minimal.lua parser.md
```

minimal.lua
```lua
for name, url in pairs {
  "https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
  "https://github.com/MeanderingProgrammer/render-markdown.nvim",
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify("nvim_issue/" .. name, ":p")
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { "git", "clone", "--depth=1", url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup {
  highlight = { enable = true }
}

require("render-markdown").setup {}
```

[parser.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19576040/parser.md)

### Expected behavior

No error

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-71+g0b61bc8982 Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS 15.3

### Terminal name/version

ghostty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

build from repro

comment_data.body:
> minimal.lua

Is this _really_ minimal? I.e., a simple `vim.treesitter.start()` in a `FileType markdown` autocommand won't trigger it? Is `render-markdown` doing anything treesitter related? If so, can you try to isolate it? That would help a lot.

(At least you should be able to remove nvim-treesitter from the config.)
(Note that there haven't been noteworthy changes to the async parsing since 0.11 was released, so I'd be surprised if you can't reproduce it on a 0.11 appimage.)

Second point first: I've been on HEAD forever. I only installed `render-markdown` a few days ago, unrelated to the release of 0.11. Later today, I will try to bisect to a commit.

First point: fair question, but I think it is minimal. With no plugins:

1. the file opens with no problem,
2. a simple `vim.treesitter.start()` throws no error, and 
3. `:Inspect` works as expected.

So, `render-markdown` is how I can produce this error, _possibly_ because it uses `parse` a lot. And it has `nvim-treesitter` as a dependency. I don't know if the bug could be reproduced simply by calling `parse` in a tight loop. Maybe @MeanderingProgrammer might have an idea.

> And it has nvim-treesitter as a dependency.

It shouldn't be, though. That's the first thing to fix. And please test the release 0.11 appimage first; bisecting to an exact commit in the 0.11 dev cycle is not as useful. (Things have been reworked too much for 0.11 for this to be an easily fixed small regression in a single commit.)

> And it has nvim-treesitter as a dependency.

`nvim-treesitter` is not needed as a dependency strictly speaking. I remember adding this at some point when parsers would sometimes not be available on the runtime path unless `nvim-treesitter` was sourced first. I think this stems from `0.9.0` behavior. Shouldn't be an issue with any newer versions.

The other purpose of the dependency is just to make sure highlights are enabled which is done through the highlights module. This part can be replaced with a `FileType` autocommand and a call to `vim.treesitter.start` like you said.

The plugin doesn't actually call into `nvim-treesitter` for any functionality.

I imagine my plugin is triggering this error due to its repeated calls to parse, there should be a way to trigger it without the plugin directly. Maybe using the autocommand + a rough approximation of how it calls parse within the callback.

With that additional info, a new `minimal.lua` without `nvim-treesitter`:
```lua
for name, url in pairs {
  "https://github.com/MeanderingProgrammer/render-markdown.nvim",
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify("nvim_issue/" .. name, ":p")
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { "git", "clone", "--depth=1", url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

require("render-markdown").setup {}

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
  pattern = 'markdown',
  callback = function (event)
    vim.treesitter.start(event.buf, 'markdown')
  end
})
```

More importantly, using the 11.0 release tarball (on a mac at the moment), I don't reproduce the error.
```
â¯ nvim -v
NVIM v0.12.0-dev-71+g0b61bc8982
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

â¯ nvim --clean -u minimal.lua parser.md
# errors

â¯ ./nvim-macos-arm64/bin/nvim -v
NVIM v0.11.0
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

â¯ ./nvim-macos-arm64/bin/nvim --clean -u minimal.lua parser.md
# no errors

I'm able to reproduce this with a combination of 2 things:

1. Running parse inside a `vim.schedule`
2. A fairly large & complex file, it seems like large on its own is not enough, I imagine it's something to do with how long it takes for neovim to finish parsing, but just a guess

I'm able to get this error fairly consistently with this `minimal.lua`:

```lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
    pattern = 'markdown',
    callback = function(event)
        local buf = event.buf
        vim.treesitter.start(buf, 'markdown')
        vim.schedule(function()
            assert(vim.treesitter.get_parser(buf)):parse({ 0, 80 })
        end)
    end,
})
```

And using the README from my repo: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MeanderingProgrammer/render-markdown.nvim/refs/heads/main/README.md

I'd paste it here but it's long, seems like 800 lines is the tipping point, but it's pretty inconsistent and sometimes smaller files will run into the error.

> More importantly, using the 11.0 release tarball (on a mac at the moment), I don't reproduce the error.

OK, then a bisect from the 0.11 release to HEAD should be quick and helpful.

Also seen in CI: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/14245003687/job/39923664812?pr=33283

```
ERROR    test/functional/treesitter/parser_spec.lua @ 217: treesitter parser API resets when buffer was editing during an async parse
test/functional/testnvim.lua:136: Error executing lua: ...eovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:406: attempt to yield across C-call boundary
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'yield'
	...eovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:406: in function '_parse_regions'
	...eovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:618: in function '_parse'
	...eovim/neovim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:585: in function 'parse'
	[string "<nvim>"]:1: in main chunk

stack traceback:
	test/functional/testnvim.lua:136: in function 'exec_lua'
	test/functional/treesitter/parser_spec.lua:243: in function <test/functional/treesitter/parser_spec.lua:217>
```
I've bisected and can confirm the errors start with f4fc769
I encountered the same error when opening mid-sized or large JavaScript files with Neovim 0.12.0. However, the error does not appear with version 0.11.1.

I recently started seeing this now

```
Error in TextChangedP Autocommands for "*"..function 54[3]..55[71]..matchup#delim#get_current[1]..<SNR>182_get_delim_multi[3]..matchup#ts_engine#get_delim[3]..<SNR>174_forward:
line    1:
E5108: Lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:424: attempt to yield across C-call boundary
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'yield'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:424: in function '_parse_regions'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:631: in function '_parse'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:598: in function 'parse'
        .../plugged/vim-matchup/lua/treesitter-matchup/internal.lua:152: in function 'get_matches'
        .../plugged/vim-matchup/lua/treesitter-matchup/internal.lua:210: in function 'get_active_matches'
        .../plugged/vim-matchup/lua/treesitter-matchup/internal.lua:376: in function 'get_delim'
        [string "luaeval()"]:1: in main chunk
```

With a recent 0.12 development release
```
NVIM v0.12.0-dev
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: /usr/bin/cc -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d=. -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -O2 -g -DRELDEBUG -flto -fno-fat-lto-objects -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -Wno-unused-function -fsigned-char -fstack-protector-strong -Wno-conversion -fno-common -Wno-unused-result -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=auto  -DUNIT_TESTING -D_GNU_SOURCE -DUTF8PROC_STATIC -I/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d/.deps/usr/include -I/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d/build/src/nvim/auto -I/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d/build/include -I/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d/build/cmake.config -I/build/neovim-h4LsNP/neovim-0.12.0~ubuntu1+git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d/src -I/usr/include

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```

Would you like me to try to reproduce it with a smaller rc?
Yes please, also sharing which commit you are on will help

Yepp, it seems to be about the matchup, and also the file I am writing in. I have a small reproducing rc now with just a few plugins to trigger it.

```
Plug 'ms-jpq/coq_nvim',         {'branch': 'coq', 'do': ':COQdeps'}

Plug 'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter',               {'do': ':TSUpdate' }
Plug 'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter-context',       {}
Plug 'andymass/vim-matchup',                {}
Plug 'neovim/nvim-lspconfig',    {}
```

Trying to craft a source file that I can distribute as well.
It comes from the completion menu of coq, and presumably an interaction between matchup and treesitter context+highlight or something (but does not require the renedered code preview of an entry.

Here is the reproduction repository: https://github.com/stagnation/reproduction-treesitter-call-across-c-boundary
```
nvim -u ./vimrc test.py
```

Where I just write "def" back and forth on line 5. It takes a little while for it to trigger, maybe half a second then the next key-press that opens the completion menu gives the crash.

It seems to depend on where in the file I write and does not trigger readily below the main function.
And reproduces more reliably the longer the main function is. I can cull it a bit, but that leads to more keypresses before it crashes.

------

> sharing which commit you are on will help

Is this enough for the commit information? git202510110420-9b03385d85-793e58f65d
Or how do I get the exact commit?

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit
labels.name: has:bisected

title: Treesitter: parse error "attempt to yield across C-call boundary"
